meta.title: Home - Upper Perkiomen School District

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout home fsHasTheme2

li.a: District Investments in AP Courses Prepare Students for College
Hereford 4th Graders Partner with Perkiomen School 8th Graders in Innovation Challenge
UPMS Drama Club Production of “Princess Who?” is Full of Laughs and Fairy-Tale Mystery
Marlborough Elementary After-School Club Teaches Kids that Science is Fun
Hereford 5th Grade Class Earns a Trip to the 80s for Good Behavior
Upper Perk Students Participate in PMEA Elementary & Junior High Song Fests
Thank you, teachers: Happy Teacher Appreciation Week
Class of 2018 Kicks Off Graduation Week with Baccalaureate Service
Career Prep Series: Middle School Hosts Career Day to Encourage Career Exploration
Members of the Class of 2018 Recall Their Time at Upper Perk and Look to the Future
UPHS Class of 2018 Walks Across the Stage During Friday Evening’s Graduation Ceremony
UPSD honors five with Distinguished Service Awards
Community Celebrations & Open Houses for the New Schools
Welcome Back for the 2019-20 School Year!
UPSD Honors Six with 2019 Distinguished Service Awards
UPSD's First GKC Encourages Kindness Across the District
Two UPHS Students Participate in PMEA District 11 Music Festivals
UPHS Student Wins MontCo Suicide Prevention Poster Contest
UPHS' Adam Dockery Named National Merit Scholarship Program Finalist
UPMS Seals Time Capsule in New Building
Fly on Over to See UPMS’ Production of Peter Pan! Jr.
Upper Perkiomen School District At Home Learning
Measure of Academic Progress - MAP Testing
Multi-Tiered System of Supports (MTSS)/Response to Instruction and Intervention (RtII)
Myths and Facts About the Common Core State Standards

div.br:
The District has issue an update regarding the Multi-Tiered System of Supports process the District has put in place.
Future Ready Index
In 2018-2019, the proposed Future Ready PA Index will serve as Pennsylvania’s one-stop location for comprehensive information about school success, and will use a dashboard model to highlight how schools are performing and making progress on multiple indicators. Read more about it above!

Please click on the 1:1 Initiative tab under this menu for detailed information about end of year device information and inventory procedures.
School District Resource Allocation Survey
The Upper Perkiomen School District is seeking school and community member feedback on how a portion of federal funds are allocated within the school district. Please complete the survey linked above and share your input on school and community priorities for Upper Perkiomen School District by June 30th.

li.a: Upper Perkiomen School District At Home Learning

div.a: Lunch Menus and Online Lunch Payments
div.br:
SchoolCafe is the system UPSD uses to manage lunch menus and online deposits into childrens' lunch accounts. Click the link to setup a SchoolCafe account and enjoy the benefits.
Employment Opportunities
Looking for employment opportunities? Please visit the Employment Opportunities page for information on available positions and the application process.

In 2018-2019, the proposed Future Ready PA Index will serve as Pennsylvania’s one-stop location for comprehensive information about school success, and will use a dashboard model to highlight how schools are performing and making progress on multiple indicators. Read more about it above!
Skyward Family Access
Parents and guardians have the ability to see a wide range of information, including grades, daily assignments, attendance, class schedules, bus information, the Message Center, etc.

In 2018-2019, the proposed Future Ready PA Index will serve as Pennsylvania’s one-stop location for comprehensive information about school success, and will use a dashboard model to highlight how schools are performing and making progress on multiple indicators. Read more about it above!
Flyer Distribution Requests
If you would like to distribute information via the District, please review our Flyer Distribution Request page.

h6.style: color: rgb(35, 35, 39); font-family: lato, %22trebuchet ms%22, arial;

div.p: Welcome to Upper Perkiomen School District
Click on "Parent Portal" at the top of the screen to access Skyward's Family Access.
Horseback riding in Green Lane Park
All Board and Workshop meetings are held at the Education Center - 2229 East Buck Road, Pennsburg.

section.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsList home-news fsThumbnailAlignLeft fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailLarge fsItemCount_2

div.p: The purpose of our At-Home Learning Program is to provide continuity of education through planned instruction for all K-12 students. UPSD's Continuity of Education Plan is available here.

article.a: Continue Reading about UPSD Continuity of Education Plan

div.p: This page includes information on the mandatory school closure due to COVID-19, UPSD resources, external resources and the latest communications from the district.

article.a: Continue Reading about Coronavirus Information & Resources

a.data-page-name: Upper Perkiomen School District At Home Learning

h4.a: Strategies for Supporting Students and Families

div.a: UPSD provides a safe and supportive school environment that values and is responsive to the uniqueness of each individual
UPSD encourages all students and staff to responsibly advocate for themselves and actively make choices in their own learning
UPSD nurtures a student centered learning environment that enhances critical and creative thinking
UPSD students will have access to a full continuum of learning experiences in order to actualize their personal growth
UPSD fosters and utilizes local and global connections to cultivate learning experiences within and beyond the classroom
